medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient first noticed mild diffuse abdominal pain 24 hours ago that he thought was consistent with constipation. After taking magnesium citrate and gasX, he had diarrhea but did not alleviate his pain. The pain continued during the day at work, worsening with walking up/down stairs or laughing. The pain subsequently moved to his right lower quadrant. He took Excedrin which did not improve his pain. He endorses poor appetite, nausea, and chills, but denies vomiting, fever, or dysuria.
